channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: American Leaders Should Stop Debasing Themselves on Israel
item.description: You have to wonder if American “friends” of Israel have any clue about the nature of Israel’s government.

item.title: Why Chinese Working Mothers Don’t Want More Babies
item.description: We spoke to three women who have rejected the government’s drive for bigger families and asked them to document their daily lives as they juggle home and the workplace.

item.title: Boeing whistleblower alleges plane maker lost track of up to 400 faulty 737 parts
item.description: Boeing inspector Sam Mohawk alleges that as of last year, the company had lost as many as 400 faulty 737 Max aircraft parts and deleted records for many of those from an internal cataloging system.

item.title: President Biden’s Distrust Challenge
item.description: We explain how one set of voters may decide the 2024 election.

item.title: Thailand’s Legislature Approves Same-Sex Marriage Measure
item.description: The bill, which needs the king’s endorsement to become law, underscores Thailand’s status as a relative haven in Asia for L.G.B.T.Q. people.

item.title: Huawei's homegrown mobile OS is proving so successful, it's reportedly thinking of charging developers for using it
item.description: Huawei's HarmonyOS is now the second-most popular mobile operating system in China, overtaking Apple's iOS.

item.title: U.S. Protections for Undocumented Spouses, and Putin’s North Korea Visit
item.description: Plus, trouble in the avocado supply.

item.title: Heavy Rains Lash Southern China, Killing at Least 9
item.description: Rains set off landslides and inundated villages in the south, forcing thousands to evacuate. In the north, residents sweltered through a drought.

item.title: FOMO still ‘ruling the market’ says Wharton’s Jeremy Siegel, as investors hold out for an elusive rate cut to boost prospects
item.description: Jeremy Siegel, emeritus professor at the University of Pennsylvania, wrote tech innovations like Nvidia are continuing to "capture the imagination" of the market.

item.title: Thailand’s Legislature Approves Same-Sex Marriage Measure
item.description: The bill, which needs the king’s endorsement to become law, underscores Thailand’s status as a relative haven in Asia for L.G.B.T.Q. people.

item.title: In Ukraine, Narrowing Press Freedoms Cause Growing Concern
item.description: Journalists say they are subject to increasing restrictions and pressure from the government of President Volodymyr Zelensky, adding that the measures go beyond wartime security needs.

item.title: Almost 2 feet of snow are predicted for the Rockies as tens of millions of people in the U.S. swelter under extreme heat alerts
item.description: Extreme heat alerts continued for tens of millions of people in the United States on Tuesday as cities including Chicago broke records at the start of a week of sweltering weather.

item.title: Doctors Test the Limits of What Obesity Drugs Can Fix
item.description: “Obesity first” doctors say they start with one pill, to treat obesity, and often find other chronic diseases, like rheumatoid arthritis, simply vanish.

item.title: Kenya Braces for Major Protests Over Proposed Tax Hikes
item.description: Activists have called on Kenyans to occupy Parliament in opposition to a new finance bill that is likely to raise the cost of living for many people by increasing taxes on a range of goods and services.

item.title: OceanGate Titan imploded 1 year ago on the way to the Titanic
item.description: A year after an experimental submersible imploded en route to the Titanic, unanswered questions linger — with no immediate answers.
